description.narrative:
Corporate and Tax Policy Research Training, July 2017, Bali, Indonesia, by SOMO
This 3 day training aims to build the research capacity of participants on corporate and policy tax issues. It intends to do this in an interactive way tailored towards the needs of participants, so that the training feeds into everyone#s daily work as much as possible. The first day of the training is focused onsharing expectations, an introduction into tax avoidance and corporate tax research. The second day will be mostly about the role of tax treaties and incentives in corporate avoiding structures, and how to research them. Based on the input on the surveys, we assess that participants are mostly interested in either treaties OR incentives. Therefore, on this second day all participants will make a choice between sessions on tax treaties or tax incentives. It will allow us to go into more detail. The last day will be used docontinue research exercises and starting your own research with support from trainers and available databases. Moreover, during this last day the program provides room for other strategic discussions, such as national and regional collaborations on tax justice. Every day will close with an evaluation session (0,5h) in order to ensure that the training meets expectations and needs of participants.
In 2016-17, Oxfam Novib, SOMO, and the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs embarked on a strategic partnership to bring about a shared vision of a just world without poverty. The Partnership, Towards a Worldwide Influencing Network, strengthens the ability of civil society organizations in the so-called Global South to bring about inclusive and meaningful policy change. Unique and crucial in this locally-driven effort is the ability of the strategic partnership to multiply local results via Oxfam#s worldwide influencing network. This leverages impact and constituencies in key international cities and platforms. SOMO supported partners in Indonesia to strengthen tax justice advocacy in relation to tax treaties with the Netherlands.

participating-org.narrative: SOMO is an independent, not-for-profit research and network organization working on social, ecological and economic issues related to sustainable development. Since 1973, the organization investigates multinational corporations and the consequences of their activities for people and the environment around the world. SOMO: -conducts its own research -conducts research for Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) -coordinates and participates in networks China.
